content.title: Patent Ductus Arteriosus
content.description: Persistent patency of ductus arteriosus connecting aorta to pulmonary artery

key_concepts.details: Left-to-right shunt causes pulmonary overcirculation and volume overload
Continuous 'machinery' murmur, widened pulse pressure, bounding pulses
Indomethacin/ibuprofen (premature infants), catheter closure (coils, devices), surgical ligation
Symptomatic PDA, significant shunt (Qp:Qs >1.5), prevention of endarteritis

content.clinical_significance: One of the most common congenital heart defects; highly treatable
